revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of 1900 May 28 at Santa Pola, Spain
tldr: The author describes the observations and equipment used during the total solar eclipse of May 28, 1900, in Santa Pola, Spain. The team used a 40-foot horizontal telescope and a small prismatic camera, capturing images of the solar corona and surrounding sun. The observations were aided by a detachment of junior officers and men from H.M.S. Theseus, who assisted in setting up and adjusting the equipment.
